FR-2: The system shall provide users with a view of their connections' shared health progress and goals, updated at least once daily.
FR-3: The system shall require users to have a registered and verified account before connecting with other users.
FR-4: The system shall allow users to control the level of detail of their health progress and goals shared with each connection, with options including "All," "Limited," and "None."
FR-5: If a user attempts to connect with a non-existent or blocked user, the system shall display an error message within 2 seconds indicating the user could not be found or is unavailable.
FR-6: The system shall notify the user via in-app notification when they receive a connection request, displayed within 10 seconds of the request being sent.
NFR-1: The system shall update the shared health progress view for connections within 5 minutes of a user updating their own health progress and goals.
NFR-2: The user interface for managing connections and viewing shared progress shall be intuitive and easy to navigate, as measured by a System Usability Scale (SUS) score of 70 or higher based on user testing.
NFR-3: The system shall ensure that all shared health data is encrypted both in transit and at rest, adhering to HIPAA compliance standards, by [Date].
